translated: The Three-Part Collection🔽The Chapter on Thoughts
“As far as the sun and moon

original: Pariharanti disā bhanti virocanā;🔽Sabbeva dāsā mandhātu,
analyzed: pariharanti disā bhanti virocanā  sabbā iva dāsā mandhātu
translated: move around, illuminating the directions,🔽all those who live on the earth

analyzed: ye pāṇā pathavissitā  na kahāpaṇa vassena
translated: are slaves to Mandhatu.🔽There is no satisfaction in sensual pleasures
sensual pleasures are of little satisfaction and much suffering,

analyzed: iti viññāya paṇḍito  api dibbesu kāmesu
translated: so the wise one should understand.🔽He does not find delight
he delights in the destruction of craving,

analyzed: sammāsambuddha sāvakaḥ iti 🔽man dhātu jātakam aṭṭhama
translated: the disciple of the Perfectly Enlightened One.”🔽The eighth birth story, that of Mandhatu.
